channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House votes to end the longest ever government shutdown
item.description: The House voted to fund the government through the end of January, bringing the country one step closer to ending the shutdown that has dragged on for six weeks. The bill now goes to President Trump for his signature.
item.content:encoded:
The House voted to fund the government through the end of January, bringing the country one step closer to ending the shutdown that has dragged on for six weeks. The bill now goes to President Trump for his signature.

(Image credit: SAUL LOEB)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: U.S. bishops officially ban gender-affirming care at Catholic hospitals
item.description: The bishops' decision formalizes a yearslong process for the U.S. church to address transgender health care. They also approved a special message on immigration, expressing concern over enforcement and conditions in detention centers.
item.content:encoded:
The bishops' decision formalizes a yearslong process for the U.S. church to address transgender health care. They also approved a special message on immigration, expressing concern over enforcement and conditions in detention centers.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Some Black police officials worry more federal agents will breed community mistrust
item.description: Missouri's governor recently authorized the state's National Guard to assist ICE with clerical duties. Black police officers fear the trust they've built with communities of color could take years to rebuild.
item.content:encoded:
Missouri's governor recently authorized the state's National Guard to assist ICE with clerical duties. Black police officers fear the trust they've built with communities of color could take years to rebuild.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Henderson

item.title: 3 questions about Trump's 50-year mortgage plan
item.description: Experts in the mortgage industry are skeptical. Buyers would pay less each month, but would end up paying more over time. Here's what to know about the proposed 50-year mortgages.
item.content:encoded:
Experts in the mortgage industry are skeptical. Buyers would pay less each month, but would end up paying more over time. Here's what to know about the proposed 50-year mortgages.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Tatsuya Nakadai, an icon of Japanese cinema, has died at 92
item.description: In a 2005 interview, the actor said that in his twenties, he was carrying the load of "everyone's masterpieces." He worked closely with directors including Akira Kurosawa and Masaki Kobayashi.
item.content:encoded:
In a 2005 interview, the actor said that in his twenties, he was carrying the load of "everyone's masterpieces." He worked closely with directors including Akira Kurosawa and Masaki Kobayashi.

(Image credit: STR/JIJI Press)
item.dc:creator: Alina Edwards

item.title: New malaria drug could be a life-saver as the standard drug shows signs of weakness
item.description: The best drug to fight malaria is facing increased resistance from the parasites it fights. Now there's an alternative in the pipeline and it looks promising.
item.content:encoded:
The best drug to fight malaria is facing increased resistance from the parasites it fights. Now there's an alternative in the pipeline and it looks promising.

(Image credit: Zubair Abbasi)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Israel's president says 'shocking' settler violence against Palestinians must end
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog added a rare and powerful voice to what has been muted criticism by top Israeli officials of Israeli settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli President Isaac Herzog added a rare and powerful voice to what has been muted criticism by top Israeli officials of Israeli settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: PBS documentary looks at 25 years of the challenges of surviving in space on the ISS
item.description: This year is the 25th anniversary of humans inhabiting the International Space Station. A new PBS documentary looks at how the ISS was built and the challenges of surviving in outer space.
item.content:encoded: This year is the 25th anniversary of humans inhabiting the International Space Station. A new PBS documentary looks at how the ISS was built and the challenges of surviving in outer space.
item.dc:creator: Jeanette Woods

item.title: The chess federation accuses a former champion of harassing a rival who died
item.description: The game's governing body has filed a complaint against Vladimir Kramnik. Other players say he spent months making unproven allegations of cheating against Daniel Naroditsky, who died last month.
item.content:encoded:
The game's governing body has filed a complaint against Vladimir Kramnik. Other players say he spent months making unproven allegations of cheating against Daniel Naroditsky, who died last month.

(Image credit: Ennio Leanza)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is Laura Loomer, President Trump's self-described chief 'loyalty enforcer'?
item.description: The New Yorker's Antonia Hitchens describes how Loomer went from a conspiracy theorist to a close ally of Trump who's gotten government officials she claims are disloyal to the president fired.
item.content:encoded: The New Yorker's Antonia Hitchens describes how Loomer went from a conspiracy theorist to a close ally of Trump who's gotten government officials she claims are disloyal to the president fired.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross
